@site = @{ play.Play.application().configuration().getString("maildrop.sitename") } @domain = @{play.Play.application().configuration().getString("maildrop.hostname")} @contactUs = @{ com.heluna.maildrop.util.AltInbox.getAltInbox(play.Play.application().configuration().getString("maildrop.contactaddr")) + "@" + domain } @template("contact", "Contact Us") {

Have Questions or Comments?

We're happy to answer any questions or discuss any comments you might have. First, though, please take these notes into consideration.

@site Cannot Send You E-mail.

@site is designed to accept e-mail messages only, and cannot send any messages. If you see any messages coming from @domain, please ignore and delete them - someone else is spoofing @domain addresses. There is no way to send a message from a @site inbox to another e-mail address.

Messages in Your Inbox May Disappear Anytime.

Due to the amount of incoming mail, older messages and inboxes that haven't received a message in a while may be automatically deleted to make space. If you're looking for a message that is older than @{ play.Play.application().configuration().getString("maildrop.mailbox.expires") } it is extremely likely that the message is gone.

Anyone Can Read Your @site E-mail.

Please see our Privacy Policy for more information. Since @site doesn't require any logins or passwords, please do not use your @site inbox for anything that you would like to be kept private or secure. @site addresses are meant to be temporary and disposable.

@site Greylists Every E-mail Server.

If @site receives a message from an e-mail server it hasn't communicated with yet, that server goes onto something called a "greylist", where the server is told it needs to re-try the message after a given period of time. Due to this, messages from new (to @site) servers may be delayed by at least fifteen minutes, and often times up to an hour.

@site Deletes Every Attachment.

Any files (photos, e-mail messages, documents, zip files, etc) that are attached to incoming e-mail messages are removed before the message is delivered to your inbox.

Still Have a Question or Comment?

No problem - just e-mail @site at @contactUs (yes, you're e-mailing a @site inbox alias!).

}
